entries.title: Joy fills Humboldt Park during ‘Benito Bowl’ halftime show watch party: 'It’s a good day to be Puerto Rican'
entries.summary: <p>Some fans were settling in to watch the Seattle Seahawks play the New England Patriots, but others were tuning in to see Puerto Rican superstar Bad Bunny take the Super Bowl stage for the halftime show.</p><p>Bad Bunny headlined Sunday’s performance, which some fans dubbed the “Benito Bowl.” The 31-year-old, born Benito Antonio Martínez Ocasio, is the first Spanish-language solo artist to headline a halftime show.</p><p>In Humboldt Park, Chicago’s largest Puerto Rican neighborhood, organizers of the annual Fiestas Puertorriqueñas hosted a watch party at their VIP Residencia pop-up space at 2701 W. Division St.</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="Enhancement-item" data-crop=""> <figure class="Figure"><a class="AnchorLink" id="image-ff0000" name="image-ff0000"></a> <picture data-crop="medium"> <source type="image/webp" width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/dcfb2de/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6048x3394+0+319/resize/490x275!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F43%2Fd4%2Fe547d1aa449db78cc7cfb816e4b5%2Fbenitobowl-260208-1.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/65501c2/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6048x3394+0+319/resize/980x550!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F43%2Fd4%2Fe547d1aa449db78cc7cfb816e4b5%2Fbenitobowl-260208-1.jpg 2x" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <source width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/4486c40/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6048x3394+0+319/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F43%2Fd4%2Fe547d1aa449db78cc7cfb816e4b5%2Fbenitobowl-260208-1.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <img class="Image" alt="An inflatable tropical-themed facade covers the entrance to VIP Residencia Bar & Lounge in Humboldt Park for the "Benito Bowl" watch party. The event, held during the NFL championship on Sunday, Feb. 8, 2026, transformed the local venue into a Caribbean-inspired fan zone." srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/4486c40/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6048x3394+0+319/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F43%2Fd4%2Fe547d1aa449db78cc7cfb816e4b5%2Fbenitobowl-260208-1.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/7de38fa/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6048x3394+0+319/resize/980x550!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F43%2Fd4%2Fe547d1aa449db78cc7cfb816e4b5%2Fbenitobowl-260208-1.jpg 2x" width="490" height="275" data-src="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/4486c40/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6048x3394+0+319/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F43%2Fd4%2Fe547d1aa449db78cc7cfb816e4b5%2Fbenitobowl-260208-1.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" > </picture> <div class="Figure-content"><figcaption class="Figure-caption"><p>An inflatable tropical-themed facade decorates the entrance to VIP Residencia Bar & Lounge in Humboldt Park for the “Benito Bowl” watch party. </p></figcaption><span class="line"></span><div class="Figure-credit"><p>Victor Hilitski/For the Sun-Times</p></div></div> </figure> </div> </div><p>The event drew dozens who cheered for the singer and sang along to his top reggaeton hits throughout the 13-minute performance. Instead of wearing their favorite team’s jersey, partygoers wore Puerto Rican flags, Bad Bunny T-shirts and <i>pavas</i>, traditional Puerto Rican straw hats.</p><p>Organizer Melissa Gomez said she wanted to create an event that would bring the community together, and Bad Bunny’s performance provided the perfect occasion to do just that.</p><p>“Bad Bunny always has shown his love for his community. For Puerto Ricans and for all Latinos,” Gomez said.</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="Enhancement-item" data-crop=""> <figure class="Figure"><a class="AnchorLink" id="image-980000" name="image-980000"></a> <picture data-crop="medium"> <source type="image/webp" width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/7298636/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5384x3022+0+284/resize/490x275!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F4b%2Fab%2F89578ca24dc69bc8cd07b3f16344%2Fbenitobowl-260208-8.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/1ed38ca/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5384x3022+0+284/resize/980x550!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F4b%2Fab%2F89578ca24dc69bc8cd07b3f16344%2Fbenitobowl-260208-8.jpg 2x" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <source width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/df143fb/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5384x3022+0+284/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F4b%2Fab%2F89578ca24dc69bc8cd07b3f16344%2Fbenitobowl-260208-8.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <img class="Image" alt="Football fans and fans of Puerto Rican super star Bad Bunny crowd the VIP Residencia Bar & Lounge in Humboldt Park, some wore traditional straw hats." srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/df143fb/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5384x3022+0+284/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F4b%2Fab%2F89578ca24dc69bc8cd07b3f16344%2Fbenitobowl-260208-8.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/fb77558/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5384x3022+0+284/resize/980x550!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F4b%2Fab%2F89578ca24dc69bc8cd07b3f16344%2Fbenitobowl-260208-8.jpg 2x" width="490" height="275" data-src="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/df143fb/2147483647/strip/true/crop/5384x3022+0+284/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F4b%2Fab%2F89578ca24dc69bc8cd07b3f16344%2Fbenitobowl-260208-8.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" > </picture> <div class="Figure-content"><figcaption class="Figure-caption"><p>Football fans and fans of Puerto Rican super star Bad Bunny crowd the VIP Residencia Bar & Lounge in Humboldt Park, some wore traditional straw hats.</p></figcaption><span class="line"></span><div class="Figure-credit"><p>Victor Hilitski/For the Sun-Times</p></div></div> </figure> </div> </div><p>That message came through during his performance, which featured men, women and children on a set reminiscent of Puerto Rico. He closed the show with a parade of flags from countries representing North, Central and South America, ending with the message “Together, we are America.”</p><p>The performance also included cameos from Lady Gaga and Ricky Martin.</p><p>“I’m feeling really so proud,” said Evelyn Cato, 60, of Logan Square. “Despite all of the negativity, he’s brought communities together.”</p><p>Bad Bunny’s performance drew both anticipation and controversy. Many fans were eager to see him headline the show, but it also sparked backlash from conservatives. The singer has been an outspoken critic of President Donald Trump's immigration policies and recently spoke out, saying "ICE out" during his recent Grammy Awards acceptance speech.</p><p>Trump posted on social media that the performance was “absolutely terrible, one of the worst, EVER!”</p><p>Turning Point USA, the organization founded by Charlie Kirk, organized an alternative, "All-American" halftime show that was promoted by Vice President J.D. Vance and featured headliner Kid Rock.</p><p>Gomez said there was “no better choice” for a halftime performer than Bad Bunny, who has been Spotify's top-streaming artist for four of the last six years.</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="Enhancement-item" data-crop=""> <figure class="Figure"><a class="AnchorLink" id="image-c60000" name="image-c60000"></a> <picture data-crop="medium"> <source type="image/webp" width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/4a75534/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6048x3394+0+319/resize/490x275!/format/webp/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F33%2F84%2Feb3f6dc645c09401a188a9e86605%2Fbenitobowl-260208-2.jpg 2x" data-lazy-load="true" srcset="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" /> <source width="490" height="275" data-srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/8e49cbf/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6048x3394+0+319/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F33%2F84%2Feb3f6dc645c09401a188a9e86605%2Fbenitobowl-260208-2.jpg" alt="A Bad Bunny cutout and large screens fill the VIP Residencia Bar & Lounge in Humboldt Park, where fans gathered for the Super Bowl halftime show." srcset="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/8e49cbf/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6048x3394+0+319/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F33%2F84%2Feb3f6dc645c09401a188a9e86605%2Fbenitobowl-260208-2.jpg 1x,https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/b31d572/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6048x3394+0+319/resize/980x550!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F33%2F84%2Feb3f6dc645c09401a188a9e86605%2Fbenitobowl-260208-2.jpg 2x" width="490" height="275" data-src="https://cst.brightspotcdn.com/dims4/default/8e49cbf/2147483647/strip/true/crop/6048x3394+0+319/resize/490x275!/quality/90/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fchorus-production-cst-web.s3.us-east-1.amazonaws.com%2Fbrightspot%2F33%2F84%2Feb3f6dc645c09401a188a9e86605%2Fbenitobowl-260208-2.jpg" data-lazy-load="true" src="data:image/svg+xml;base64,PHN2ZyB4bWxucz0iaHR0cDovL3d3dy53My5vcmcvMjAwMC9zdmciIHZlcnNpb249IjEuMSIgaGVpZ2h0PSIyNzVweCIgd2lkdGg9IjQ5MHB4Ij48L3N2Zz4=" > </picture> <div class="Figure-content"><figcaption class="Figure-caption"><p>A Bad Bunny cutout and large screens fill the VIP Residencia Bar & Lounge in Humboldt Park, where fans gathered for the Super Bowl halftime show, which featured Bad Bunny, Lady Gaga and Ricky Martin.</p></figcaption><span class="line"></span><div class="Figure-credit"><p>Victor Hilitski/For the Sun-Times</p></div></div> </figure> </div> </div><p>“I've always loved watching the performances, no matter who it is,” she said. “The Super Bowl halftime has always been the top-charting artist at the time, and that's Benito right now.”</p><p>Bad Bunny first appeared on the Super Bowl stage during the 2020 halftime show, when he joined headliners Shakira and Jennifer Lopez as a guest performer.</p><p>Erika Latines, 49, who showed up at the party in her favorite Bad Bunny T-shirt, said the singer is one of the few artists who uses their platform to speak out against injustice.</p><p>“His messages are not just for Latinos, it’s for humanity,” Latines said.</p><p>Latines, who lives on the South Side, said Chicago “needed” to be able to gather and celebrate after several neighborhoods were recently targeted by Trump’s aggressive deportation campaign that saw hundreds of federal agents fanning out across neighborhoods, stoking fear.</p><p>“The Super Bowl brings us together, not because of the NFL, but because of who we are as a community,” she said.</p><p>Ald. Jessie Fuentes (26th) was among the crowd and said she joined to show support for a small business and pride for her Puerto Rican heritage.</p><p>“It’s a good day to be Puerto Rican,” she said.</p><p>Fuentes also added it was important for Latino communities to share in joy after communities across the country have been “terrorized” by the Trump administration.</p><p>“It’s an exciting day to resist and to show the world that Latinos belong here,” she said.</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center> <div class="Enhancement-item"> <bsp-carousel class="Carousel Enhancement" entries.author: Cindy Hernandez

entries.title: Super Bowl LX: Seahawks defense rocks Patriots for 29-13 win, lurks as challenge for Bears next season
entries.summary: <p>SANTA CLARA, Calif. — If the Bears and quarterback Caleb Williams are able to step into being a contender next season, the Seahawks’ defense will be waiting for them. After what they did throughout the season and in Super Bowl LX on Sunday, that’s going to be daunting for everyone in the NFL.</p><p>The Seahawks shut down the Patriots at nearly every turn to win 29-13 and capture their second championship and avenge the Legion of Boom’s brutal loss to Tom Brady 11 years ago.</p><p>They threatened to deliver the first shutout in Super Bowl history, holding the Patriots scoreless until a lapse early in the fourth quarter, before allowing two late touchdowns.</p><p>Seahawks coach Mike Macdonald’s defense ran the show.</p><p>They essentially sealed the game when safety Julian Love, who grew up in Logan Square and played at Nazareth Academy, intercepted a pass that Patriots quarterback Drake Maye sailed over the middle of the field as he desperately tried to give the Patriots a chance.</p><p>Love intercepted the ball with 8:37 remaining and returned it 35 yards into Patriots territory to set up another score and give the Seahawks a commanding 22-7 lead.</p><p>The Seahawks followed that with another takeaway when cornerback Devon Witherspoon, from University of Illinois, hit Maye as he threw, and the ball deflected to linebacker Uchenna Nwosu in the backfield. Nwosu had a clear path to the end zone for a 45-yard touchdown return.</p><p>The game didn’t have the star power or thrills of recent Super Bowls, but the Seahawks don’t care. Everyone can call it boring while they party in the Bay Area and start designing championship rings.</p><p>The legends of the Seahawks’ previous era couldn’t help but love this defense. After allowing the fewest points in the league during the regular season, the Seahawks forced the Patriots to punt on their first eight possessions and didn’t let them cross the Seattle 40-yard line until Maye’s 24-yard pass to Mack Hollins with 12:35 remaining.</p><p>Their defensive line continued to be one of the most overwhelming forces in the NFL, pressuring Maye throughout the game and holding him to 27-for-43 passing for 295 yards with two touchdowns and two interceptions.</p><p>The Seahawks sacked him six times and forced him into three turnovers.</p><p>The only reason the Patriots didn’t punt a ninth consecutive time to open the game was because Seahawks pass rusher Derick Hall sacked Maye on a third-and-five near midfield, and defensive tackle Byron Murphy II recovered it at the Patriots’ 37-yard line with 10 seconds left in the third quarter.</p><p>It was devastating for a Patriots team that couldn’t get anything going.</p><p>The Seahawks turned that into a 16-yard touchdown pass from Sam Darnold to tight end AJ Barner for a 19-0 lead.</p><p>Maye answered with the pass to Hollins, the Patriots’ longest play of the game, and went back to him for a 35-yard touchdown pass on the next play, but it was too late for a rally at that point.</p><p>Throughout the Bears’ rebuild under general manager Ryan Poles the last four seasons, the challenge has been not only to solve all of their problems, but to outrace teams around the league that are trying to do the same. Rebuilding is a zero-sum competition.</p><p>The Seahawks went 25-26 over the 2021 through ’23 seasons before resetting with the hire McDonald in ’24 and signing Darnold going into this season. Rebuild complete, no question.</p><p>The same can be said of the Patriots despite the loss. They were in worse shape than the Bears after back-to-back 4-13 seasons in 2023 and ’24, but like the Bears, found their answer in a capable coach in Mike Vrabel and a competent offensive strategist in coordinator Josh McDaniels.</p><p>That led to a breakout season for Maye, who leapfrogged Williams, the Commanders’ Jayden Daniels and the Broncos’ Bo Nix in the ongoing quarterback battle of the 2024 draft class by leading the league with a 113.5 passer rating, finishing second in the MVP voting and becoming the first from that group to reach a Super Bowl.</p><p>Seeing how well the Seahawks played is a reminder to the Bears that as exciting as their season was, their next step forward will be even hard. They’ve made progress, but there’s a lot to catch up to around the league, and this could be a tough opponent to get past for years.</p>
entries.author: Jason Lieser

entries.title: Kyle Williams' Super 25 high school girls basketball rankings for Feb. 8, 2026
entries.summary: <p>Downers Grove North junior guard Campbell Thulin is always moving.</p><p>She regularly flies around the court searching for deflections, rebounds or trying to make herself available for her teammates to pass to. As soon as the ball leaves her fingertips, she darts toward the basket to try and get an offensive rebound if she knows it's off. Her relentless motor sets the tone for a Trojans team that, at 26-2, is enjoying one of the best seasons in program history.</p><p>After beating Hinsdale Central 48-32 on Friday, Downers Grove North clinched the West Suburban Conference Silver championship. Thulin scored a game-high 18 points. Senior guard Ady Fanta added 12 points and five rebounds, and freshman guard Eva Yerkovich scored seven points.</p><p>"It's really important to us," Thulin said of winning the conference. "It's a tribute to how hard we work. This [win] just gets us even more motivated for playoffs and to be ready to play like that."</p><p>The Trojans have won 12 straight games and are clicking at the right time.</p><p>"I like where we're at," Trojans coach Stephan Bolt said. " Defensively, we're tough and communicative. Offensively, we're starting to make some shots. We're seeing some things. We're executing what we're trying to execute, and it's fun to see them doing that, and it only gives them more confidence, which is, it's the right time to be doing that."</p><p>One of the keys for the Trojans is their stifling defense. They're absolutely suffocating and might be the best defense in the area. If a player gets beat off the dribble, there's a Trojan ready in help position.</p><p>When the Trojans are guarding drives, everyone does a good job of digging down, trying to dislodge the ball and create a deflection.The team has a freneticism on defense.</p><p>"It's our energy," Thulin said. "We play music on the bus. We bring the speaker [into] the locker room. It's kind of like a fun environment. We don't let the energy go down. We have to carry it [throughout the game]. Our coaches do a really good job with the stuff you do for practice. They give us good practice plans, and all we got to do is do what they're telling us to do."</p><p><b>Milestone moments</b></p><p>• Carmel freshman forward Liv Johnson is the best freshman in the state, and that might be underselling her. In Saturday's win against Benet, Johnson set the single-game scoring record after a 39-point performance. It's rare to see a freshman with her mix of shooting, basketball IQ and physicality. Johnson has already received offers from Illinois, Iowa, DePaul, Ohio State and Oklahoma. She's going to be fun to watch during the playoffs.</p><p>• Loyola senior guards Marycait Mackie and Clare Weasler became the winningest players in program history (127 wins). Mackie and Weasler are critical to Loyola's success because of their willingness to rebound, defend, and sacrifice individual numbers for team success.</p><p>• Maine East guard Arabella Silva scored a career-high 46 points in a win over Niles West. She's already surpassed 2,000 points as a junior.</p><p><b>The Super 25, with record and last week’s ranking:</b></p><p><b>1. Nazareth (25-3) 1</b></p><p>Beat Marist</p><p><b>2. Loyola Academy (28-2) 2</b></p><p>Won the GCAC Tournament</p><p><b>3. Waubonsie Valley (28-1) 4</b></p><p>Plays Naperville Central Tuesday</p><p><b>4. Kenwood (20-6) 5</b></p><p>Plays Lane Tech Wednesday</p><p><b>5. Benet (22-4) 3</b></p><p>Loss to Carmel</p><p><b>6. Mother McAuley (22-6) 6</b></p><p>Loss to Loyola</p><p><b>7. Downers Grove North (26-2) 8</b></p><p>Beat Hinsdale Central Friday</p><p><b>8. Naperville Central (23-6) 7</b></p><p>Loss to Oswego East</p><p><b>9. Fremd (22-6) 9</b></p><p>Beat Lyons</p><p><b>10. Providence (27-4) 10</b></p><p>Third place in GCAC Tournament</p><p><b>11. Carmel (20-8) 13</b></p><p>Plays Marist Monday</p><p><b>12. Marist (21-8) 11</b></p><p>Loss to Nazareth Saturday</p><p><b>13. Libertyville (22-5) 18</b></p><p>Beat Maine South Saturday</p><p><b>14. DePaul Prep (21-6) 12</b></p><p>Loss to Providence</p><p><b>15. Maine South (21-8) 14</b></p><p>Loss to Libertyville</p><p><b>16. Glenbard West (25-4) 15</b></p><p>Loss to Lyons</p><p><b>17. Glenbrook South (21-8) 17</b></p><p>Plays Libertyville Monday</p><p><b>18. Hersey (18-7) 16</b></p><p>Loss to Prospect</p><p><b>19. Lyons (19-9) 21</b></p><p>Beat Glenbard West</p><p><b>20. Hinsdale Central (18-10) 24</b></p><p>Plays Evanston Thursday</p><p><b>25. St. Charles East (17-11) 25</b></p><p>Plays Geneva Tuesday<br></p>
entries.author: Kyle Williams

entries.title: Chicago Tribune owner Alden wants to acquire publisher of northwest suburban Daily Herald
entries.summary: <p>The investment fund that owns the Chicago Tribune wants to acquire the suburban Daily Herald newspaper but could be in for a fight.</p><p>Alden Global Capital, aggressive as a buyer and cost-cutter at American newspapers, declared its desire for the Daily Herald via a full-page ad in Sunday’s Tribune. The Herald, long a dominant source of northwest suburban news, has shared the misfortune of traditional media outlets struggling to keep an audience and advertisers in the digital age.</p><p>The ad was a statement from the Tribune itself addressed to shareholders of Paddock Publications, which owns the Herald. It said, “We, at the Chicago Tribune, can pay the highest price to acquire Paddock, 30% more than anyone else. We can also offer the best employment terms for Paddock’s employees.”</p><div class="Enhancement" data-align-center><div class="Enhancement-item"> <div class="ExternalContent-wrapper" > <div class="TweetUrl"> <blockquote class="twitter-tweet"><p lang="en" dir="ltr">The <a href="https://twitter.com/chicagotribune?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">@chicagotribune</a> wants to buy the Daily Herald <a href="https://t.co/ngZlceTvQw">pic.twitter.com/ngZlceTvQw</a></p>— Gregory Royal Pratt (@royalpratt) <a href="https://twitter.com/royalpratt/status/2020496799518306428?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw">February 8, 2026</a></blockquote> <script async src="https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js" charset="utf-8"></script> </div> </div> </div></div><p>In January, Paddock filed a notice with the state that it is considering a sale. The notice included no details, and the company has issued none since then.</p><p>Current and former media people familiar with the Herald speculated privately that the company could be sold to Crystal Lake-based Shaw Media, which owns newspapers and radio stations across northern Illinois and Iowa. Its papers, some just outside Daily Herald territory, include the Northwest Herald in Crystal Lake, the Kane County Chronicle and the Herald-News in Joliet.</p><p>Publicists and executives at Alden, Shaw and Paddock did not return messages Sunday.</p><p>The Alden-Tribune pitch acknowledged Paddock’s unusual situation. It’s an employee-owned company and to support a bid from Alden, workers might want assurances about job security.</p><p>Alden, however, is known for ruthless cost-cutting at its more than 200 daily and weekly newspapers. At the Tribune, it has reduced staff via several rounds of buyouts and layoffs since it took over in 2021.</p><div class="RelatedList Enhancement" data-module data-align-center> <div class="RelatedList-title">Related</div> <ul class="RelatedList-items"> <li class="RelatedList-items-item"> <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/news/2025/07/24/chicago-tribune-newsroom-layoffs-alden-global-capital" >Chicago Tribune lays off 8 from newsroom, including 5 union members</a> </li> <li class="RelatedList-items-item"> <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/business/2021/2/16/22286555/tribune-publishing-sells-to-alden-global-capital" >Tribune Publishing sells to Alden Global Capital</a> </li> </ul> </div> <p>In 2023, Alden bought the Daily Herald’s printing plant in Schaumburg to keep producing the Tribune and serve the Sun-Times, Herald and other customers. The deal was needed because Alden sold the <a class="Link" href="https://chicago.suntimes.com/2023/5/5/23712729/ballys-casino-chicago-goose-island-freedom-center-tribune" >former Tribune printing plant in 2022 </a>for $200 million. The former printing plant has been demolished to make way for a Bally’s casino.</p><p>Alden’s reputation worked against it last year when shareholders refused to sell it the Dallas Morning News, preferring instead a lower offer from Hearst. In 2022, Alden was thwarted in its bid for Lee Enterprises, publisher of the St. Louis Post-Dispatch and other papers.<br></p>
entries.author: David Roeder
